Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: The establishment of a biosecurity centre in Kenya

description.narrative:
CBB endeavoured to build the capacity of a biosecurity agency pending the adoption of biosecurity bill. However, with the bill awaiting enactment, it was not possible to establish the centre without the legal backing of the bill.
Engagements with National Commission For Science, Technology & Innovation (NACOSTI) over optimal biosecurity setup were not final by the end of the engagement.

title.narrative: The establishment of a biosecurity centre in Kenya

title.narrative: Strengthened knowledge of biosecurity and biopreparedness nationally

description.narrative:
CBB was unable to find a partner with a clear mandate and resources to receive biopreparedness capacity building and be a channel for information dissemination at an adequate level.
Preparation of a book about the Danish biopreparedness model shared with Kenyan stakeholders in 2019.

title.narrative: Kenya helps bring biosecurity and biopreparedness on the regional agenda

description.narrative:
• Joint CBB, NACOSTI and Kenya’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs side-event at the BWC Meetings of Experts at the United Nations Office in Geneva (2018), CBB and NACOSTI presentations at BWC workshop in Addis Ababa (2018), CBB presentation at a BWC workshop in Pretoria (2018), CBB participation in Global Biosecurity Dialogue in Addis Ababa (2019).
• Critical to continuously take stock of risks and maintain high-level dialogue when expected progress does not materialise (in this case the lack of progress on the biosafety bill).

title.narrative: Kenya helps bring biosecurity and biopreparedness on the regional agenda

description.narrative:
• Joint CBB, NACOSTI and Kenya’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs side-event at the BWC Meetings of Experts at the United Nations Office in Geneva (2018), CBB and NACOSTI presentations at BWC workshop in Addis Ababa (2018), CBB presentation at a BWC workshop in Pretoria (2018), CBB participation in Global Biosecurity Dialogue in Addis Ababa (2019).
• Critical to continuously take stock of risks and maintain high-level dialogue when expected progress does not materialise (in this case the lack of progress on the biosafety bill).

title.narrative: Support for the legislative process in the area.

description.narrative:
• Meetings with Cabinet Secretaries, Principal Secretaries, Senior officials in the Ministry of Education and Ministry of Health (2017-2018). • High level meeting with Kenyan biosecurity stakeholders (2018). • Draft biosecurity legislation with considerable Danish footprints (2019)
CBB worked closely with the National Commission for Science, Technology & Innovation (NACOSTI) to draft the biosecurity bill that is still awaiting adopti0on in Parliament. Political moboliatization for support of the bill was ongoing at the end of the engagement but did not materialize into legislation in force.

CBB worked closely with the National Commission for Science, Technology & Innovation (NACOSTI) to draft the biosecurity bill that is still awaiting adopti0on in Parliament. Political moboliatization for support of the bill was ongoing at the end of the engagement but did not materialize into legislation in force.

title.narrative: Training of relevant authorities in biopreparedness

description.narrative: • The programme managed to raise awareness around biosecurity and safety at several universities. However, despite statements made by the Kenyan government, biosecurity is not yet an integrated part of the Security Standards and Guidelines for universities. • There was limited institutional support for further training and awareness by Kenyan partners. • Awareness raising among close to 450 students, researchers and lecturers at leading life-science universities (2017-2018) • 8 leading life-science universities appointed biosecurity officers and 4 universities subsequently established biosecurity committees or discussed how to integrate biosecurity in university curricula.
